title: World welcomes 2026 after a year of Trump, truces and turmoil
byline: New Year’s Eve revellers toasted the end of 2025 on Wednesday (Dec 31), waving goodbye to 12 months packed with Trump tariffs, a Gaza truce and vain hopes for peace in Ukraine.

title: Let’s strive to find just and lasting solutions to problems of all citizens - Opposition Leader
byline: Let’s strive to find just and lasting solutions to problems of all citizens - Opposition Leader

title: Let’s step into New Year with renewed energy and hope to succeed in 2026: PM Harini
byline: Let’s step into New Year with renewed energy and hope to succeed in 2026: PM Harini

title: Sri Lanka usher in 2026 with vibrant New Year’s celebrations
byline: Colombo was illuminated by a fireworks show as Sri Lanka welcomed the dawn of the new year.

title: Fairly heavy showers about 75 mm likely in several provinces today
byline: Showers or thundershowers will occur at times in Eastern, Central, North-central and Uva provinces today, the Department of Meteorology stated.

title: President calls for unity and determination to rebuild Sri Lanka in his New Year message
byline: As we step into the New Year 2026, we do so as a nation that has shouldered the greatest reform programme and reconstruction effort in our modern history, President Anura Kumara Dissanayake stated.

title: Asgiriya Chief Prelate urges everyone to set aside divisions and rebuild the country
byline: Everyone should work together by setting aside ethnic differences to rebuild the country, emphasized the Chief Prelate of the Asgiriya chapter of Siam Nikaya, Most Venerable Warakagoda Sri Gnanarathana Thero in his New Year message.

title: France plans social media ban for children under 15
byline: France will make a fresh attempt to protect children from excessive screen time, proposing a ban on social media access for children under 15 by next September, according to a draft law seen by AFP.

title: Colombo inflation remains unchanged at 2.1% in December 2025
byline: The overall rate of inflation, as measured by the Colombo Consumer Price Index (CCPI) on a Year-on-Year (Y-o-Y) basis, remains unchanged at 2.1% in December 2025, compared to the month of November, according to the latest data released by the Department of Census and Statistics (DCS).

title: Close associate of organized criminal arrested with narcotics in Dondra
byline: An individual has been arrested in Gandara, Dondra for the possession of 115 grams and 200 milligrams of heroin, 23 grams and 700 milligrams of crystal methamphetamine(‘Ice’) and approximately Rs. 500,000 in cash suspected to have been earned through drug trafficking, police stated.

title: Oil prices log steepest annual drop since 2020
byline: Oil prices fell on Wednesday and recorded an annual loss of nearly 20%, as expectations of oversupply increased in a year marked by wars, higher tariffs, increased OPEC+ output and sanctions on Russia, Iran and Venezuela.

title: Police Sub-Inspector arrested on bribery charges
byline: A Sub-Inspector attached to the Kinniya Police Station has been arrested on bribery charges.

title: Sri Lanka Rupee depreciates by 5.6% against US dollar in 2025
byline: The Sri Lanka rupee had depreciated by 5.6 per cent against the US dollar in 2025, the Central Bank of Sri Lanka (CBSL) has confirmed.

title: Bulgaria officially adopts euro, becoming 21st eurozone member
byline: Bulgaria - the poorest country in the European Union - has become the 21st member of the eurozone - leapfrogging more obvious and prosperous candidates like Poland, the Czech Republic and Hungary.

title: Couple arrested at BIA with cigarettes worth Rs. 5.25 million
byline: A couple who attempted to smuggle a consignment of foreign-manufactured cigarettes worth Rs. 5.25 million into the country has been arrested at the arrival terminal of the Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA).

title: Central Bank announces closure of Public Debt Department
byline: The Central Bank of Sri Lanka (CBSL) has announced the closure of the Public Debt Department (PDD) and the transfer of the LankaSecure Division of the PDD to the Payments and Settlements Department (PSD), effective today (01).

title: Ex-President Ranil greets SJB leader Sajith for New Year and discusses future plans
byline: Former President Ranil Wickremesinghe has extended New Year greetings to Leader of the Opposition Sajith Premadasa in a phone conversation.

title: Drunk driver who ignored police orders kills officer on New Year’s Eve
byline: An officer attached to the Ambalantota Police who was on duty on New Year’s Eve has died after being run over by a car driven by an individual who was under the influence, police stated.

title: Concessionary loan scheme announced to purchase paddy in Maha Season
byline: A pledge loan scheme for Small and Medium Scale Paddy Millers and Cooperative Societies, at a concessionary interest rate has been announced to purchase paddy in the 2025/2026 Maha Season.

title: “Zootopia 2” breaks record to become top-grossing Disney animation film
byline: Walt Disney Animation Studios’ “Zootopia 2” surpassed 2019’s “Frozen 2” to become its highest-grossing film ever, the company said on Wednesday, marking a bright spot in a year when global box office continues to trail pre-pandemic levels.

title: Several killed in fire at New Year’s party in Swiss ski resort, police say
byline: Several people have been killed and others injured after a fire at a new year’s party at an Alpine ski resort in southern Switzerland, a police spokesperson said.

title: Energy Ministry to transfer CEB assets to six new companies before Feb. 1
byline: The process of transferring Ceylon Electricity Board (CEB) assets to six newly established companies must be completed before February 1, 2026, the Secretary to the Ministry of Energy, Professor Udayanga Hemapala has notified the CEB.

title: Upgrading of 76 rural roads begins under “Punarudayata Maga” programme
byline: Upgrading of 76 rural roads across the country commenced today (01) under the “Punarudayata Maga” (Path to Renaissance) programme, which aims to improve the standard of life in rural communities and enhance public transportation facilities.

title: Zohran Mamdani sworn in as New York City mayor at historic subway station
byline: Zohran Mamdani became mayor of New York City just after midnight Thursday, taking the oath of office at an historic, decommissioned subway station in Manhattan.

title: Ranil greets Sajith for New Year and discusses future plans
byline: Former President Ranil Wickremesinghe has extended New Year greetings to Leader of the Opposition Sajith Premadasa in a phone conversation.

title: 154-year-old Amsterdam church engulfed in flames on New Year’s Eve
byline: An iconic church in Amsterdam has been partially destroyed after a fire ripped through its spire in the early hours of New Year’s Day.

title: MTV shuts down remaining music channels worldwide after 44 years on air
byline: MTV is set to shut down its remaining music-only channels worldwide, bringing an end to 44 years of round-the-clock music broadcasting and prompting an outpouring of nostalgia from viewers.

title: Sri Lankan FM meets Tarique Rahman, conveys condolences on ex-Bangladesh PM’s death
byline: Sri Lankan Foreign Minister Vijitha Herath, who is currently visiting Dhaka, paid a courtesy call on Acting Chairman of Bangladesh National Party (BNP), Tarique Rahman on Wednesday night (December 31).

title: Sri Lankan man arrested by ICE no longer a professor at US State University, officials say
byline: A Ferris State University associate professor from Sri Lanka who was placed on administrative leave is no longer employed by the university, a school official has confirmed.

title: Sri Lanka CERT warns of growing cyber threats as complaints exceed 12,600 in 2025
byline: The Sri Lanka Computer Emergency Readiness Team (Sri Lanka CERT) has received more than 12,650 complaints related to social media misuse and cybersecurity incidents in 2025.

title: President pays homage to the Sacred Tooth Relic in Kandy
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake visited the historic Sri Dalada Maligawa in Kandy this morning (01), where he paid homage to the Sacred Tooth Relic and received blessings for the New Year.

title: Sri Lanka Navy honours foreign warships for disaster assistance
byline: Highlighting the spirit of global and regional cooperation, the Sri Lanka Navy today acknowledged the invaluable support by foreign warships, which had arrived to take part in the International Fleet Review (IFR) 2025, extending much-needed Humanitarian Assistance and Disaster Relief (HADR) operations,...

title: Around 40 killed, 100 injured in explosion in Swiss ski resort bar
byline: Around 40 people have been killed and 100 injured, most of them seriously, after an explosion tore through a crowded bar during a New Year’s Eve party in the upscale ski resort of Crans-Montana, Swiss officials said on Thursday.

title: NIE Director General temporarily steps down pending inquiry into ‘Grade 6 module’ controversy
byline: The Director General of the National Institute of Education (NIE), Prof. Manjula Vithanapathirana, has decided to temporarily step down from her position until the conclusion of the inquiry into the controversial Grade 6 English module.

title: Sri Lanka received humanitarian aid from 22 countries for victims of Cyclone Ditwah
byline: Sri Lanka has received humanitarian assistance from 22 foreign countries and the World Food Programme (WFP) to support communities affected by Cyclone Ditwah, according to the Ministry of Defence.

title: Three including 2 women stabbed to death in Mawanella; suspect arrested
byline: Three people, including two women, were stabbed to death in the Kondeniya area of Mawanella, police said.

title: SLTB launches new digital payment system for bus services
byline: Under the nationwide initiative to introduce innovative digital solutions, the Ministry of Transport, Highways, and Urban Development today (01) launched a new program for Sri Lanka Transport Board (SLTB) buses.

title: President reviews resettlement of Ankumbura–Gankotuwa landslide victims
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake visited the temporary shelter operating at the Sri Sudarshanaramaya Temple, Welgala, Poojapitiya in Kandy, this afternoon (01), to inquire into the well-being of families displaced by the landslide in the Ankumbura, Gankotuwa area and to review ongoing resettlement efforts.

title: Laugfs hikes domestic LP gas prices
byline: Laugfs Gas has announced an increase in domestic LP Gas refill prices, effective from today, 01 January 2026.
